title: How to Make Carmelita Bars

steps.headline: Add the 2 cups white sugar and 1/2 cup water in the saucepan, while the heat is at medium-high.
Stir moderately to mix the contents once the sugar is melting toward the edges.
Stir vigorously once the mixture is dark amber and turn the heat to low.
Add 4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) of butter.
steps.description: Once the butter is totally melted, add the lukewarm cream slowly, while stirring slowly. Once the cream has been added, stir moderately until it is all incorporated. Turn off the heat and set it aside.

steps.headline: Add the flour, oatmeal, brown sugar, baking soda, chocolate chips, and salt and mix on low speed in the mixing bowl.
Microwave the remaining butter until melted.
Add and incorporate this with the ingredients in the mixing bowl.
Split half the dough and press into baking pan.
Put most (about 3/4) of the caramel sauce on top of the dough.
Press the remaining dough on top of caramel.
Spread remaining caramel on top of dough.

text: Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Lubricate the baking pan.  Add the 2 cups white sugar and 1/2 cup water in the saucepan, while the heat is at medium-high.  Stir moderately to mix the contents once the sugar is melting toward the edges.  Stir vigorously once the mixture is dark amber and turn the heat to low.  Add 4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) of butter. Once the butter is totally melted, add the lukewarm cream slowly, while stirring slowly. Once the cream has been added, stir moderately until it is all incorporated. Turn off the heat and set it aside. Add the flour, oatmeal, brown sugar, baking soda, chocolate chips, and salt and mix on low speed in the mixing bowl.  Microwave the remaining butter until melted.  Add and incorporate this with the ingredients in the mixing bowl.  Split half the dough and press into baking pan.  Put most (about 3/4) of the caramel sauce on top of the dough.  Press the remaining dough on top of caramel.  Spread remaining caramel on top of dough.  Bake for 20 minutes.  Finished.
